definition: Information that has been published externally or is intended for public consumption without restriction.
Information intended solely for internal use by bank employees and authorized contractors. Unauthorized disclosure could cause minor operational impact.
examples: Standard operating procedures (SOPs) not restricted by domain

definition: Information intended for users on a strict need-to-know basis. Unauthorized disclosure could cause significant reputational, operational, or legal impact.
Information of the highest sensitivity. Unauthorized disclosure would cause severe operational, legal, or reputational damage to the bank.
